A cappuccino war breaks out in Berlin
subhead: In the German capital, a coffee chain is booming on the promise of affordable prices. The success is generating as much enthusiasm as hostility, with some seeing it as the work of destructive 'turbo-capitalism.'

headline: Yohann Aucante: 'If Swedish unions, among the wealthiest, most powerful and most legitimate, cannot make Tesla yield, who can?'
subhead: Yohann Aucante reflects on a 600-day strike led by a Swedish union against Tesla. In his view, the exceptionally large-scale labor action exposes some of the paradoxes of the automotive sector's shift to electric vehicles, a transition that sometimes comes at the expense of workers' rights.

headline: The singular Georges de La Tour at the Musée Jacquemart-André
subhead: Some 30 works attributed to the painter, whose life remains little known, are on display in Paris. In the absence of a clear chronology, the paintings have been categorized by subject − both secular and sacred.

headline: Antarctica's tourism boom accelerates melting of 'white continent'
subhead: While the number of tourists has skyrocketed over the past decade, the pristine continent, which is attracting growing interest among researchers, is gradually deteriorating.

Robert Redford, legend of American cinema, dies at 89
subhead: From 'The Sting' to 'Out of Africa,' the actor and director embodied a certain kind of American cinema, generous and progressive. To encourage independent production, he created the Sundance Institute in 1981. He died on Tuesday, at the age of 89.

headline: Israel attacks Gaza City as Netanyahu casts himself as a victim amid risk of isolation
subhead: As Israel steps up its strikes on the main city in the Palestinian enclave, the prime minister, facing growing isolation on the international stage, continues to defend his policy.

headline: Charlie Kirk assassination: The suspect's disconcerting profile
subhead: Tyler Robinson, arrested on Thursday night, is a 22-year-old White man who grew up in a conservative family in Utah and was a brilliant high school student. Nothing in his background supports the theory being propagated in MAGA circles that he is a far-left activist.
